displayed_text:
Below is a summary of people's opinions on the issue.

Looking at the deliberation comments on how AI has changed people's lives, several key themes emerge:

Productivity and Work Enhancement

A significant portion of participants report that AI has transformed their professional lives by streamlining workflows and increasing efficiency. Many describe using AI to automate routine tasks, draft emails, create documents, and speed up research processes. Participants particularly value AI's ability to help with writing tasks - from professional communications to resumes and cover letters. Some mention specific use cases like helping with business operations, academic work, and creative projects.

Information Access and Learning

Many participants appreciate AI as an enhanced search tool that provides quick, summarized information. Several compare AI favorably to traditional search engines, noting that it offers more direct answers and synthesizes information effectively. Participants use AI for diverse learning purposes - from technical subjects to language learning, homework assistance, and understanding complex concepts. The technology is seen as making information more accessible and easier to digest.

Creative and Personal Support

AI serves as a creative catalyst for many, helping with art generation, writing inspiration, and brainstorming ideas. Some participants report using AI for personal matters like mental health support, conflict resolution, and lifestyle advice. Several mention using AI for practical daily tasks such as meal planning, trip planning, and home improvement ideas.

Mixed Feelings and Concerns

While many express positive experiences, a notable subset of participants harbor significant concerns. Privacy and data security emerge as major worries, with participants expressing unease about AI's data collection capabilities. Job security concerns are prevalent, with some fearing AI will eventually replace human workers. Trust issues are common - participants report being more skeptical of online content and struggling to distinguish between AI-generated and human-created material.

Minimal Impact

A distinct group reports that AI has had little to no significant impact on their lives. These participants view AI as an optional tool or form of entertainment rather than a life-changing technology. Some actively avoid using AI or limit their engagement with it.

Social and Ethical Considerations

Several participants raise concerns about AI's broader societal impact. Issues mentioned include the erosion of critical thinking skills, the spread of misinformation, environmental concerns, and the loss of human authenticity in creative works. Some worry about AI's effect on social media interactions and genuine human connections.

The overall sentiment reveals a complex relationship with AI technology - while many embrace its practical benefits, there remains substantial ambivalence about its long-term implications for privacy, employment, and human creativity.

Two summaries of opinions are shown below. Read carefully and answer according to your prior opinion. Both are scrollable.

Summary A

Looking at the deliberation comments on how AI has changed people's lives, several key themes emerge:

Productivity and Work Enhancement

A significant portion of participants report that AI has transformed their professional lives by streamlining workflows and increasing efficiency. Many describe using AI to automate routine tasks, draft emails, create documents, and speed up research processes. Participants particularly value AI's ability to help with writing tasks - from professional communications to resumes and cover letters. Some mention specific use cases like helping with business operations, academic work, and creative projects.

Information Access and Learning

Many participants appreciate AI as an enhanced search tool that provides quick, summarized information. Several compare AI favorably to traditional search engines, noting that it offers more direct answers and synthesizes information effectively. Participants use AI for diverse learning purposes - from technical subjects to language learning, homework assistance, and understanding complex concepts. The technology is seen as making information more accessible and easier to digest.

Creative and Personal Support

AI serves as a creative catalyst for many, helping with art generation, writing inspiration, and brainstorming ideas. Some participants report using AI for personal matters like mental health support, conflict resolution, and lifestyle advice. Several mention using AI for practical daily tasks such as meal planning, trip planning, and home improvement ideas.

Mixed Feelings and Concerns

While many express positive experiences, a notable subset of participants harbor significant concerns. Privacy and data security emerge as major worries, with participants expressing unease about AI's data collection capabilities. Job security concerns are prevalent, with some fearing AI will eventually replace human workers. Trust issues are common - participants report being more skeptical of online content and struggling to distinguish between AI-generated and human-created material.

Minimal Impact

A distinct group reports that AI has had little to no significant impact on their lives. These participants view AI as an optional tool or form of entertainment rather than a life-changing technology. Some actively avoid using AI or limit their engagement with it.

Social and Ethical Considerations

Several participants raise concerns about AI's broader societal impact. Issues mentioned include the erosion of critical thinking skills, the spread of misinformation, environmental concerns, and the loss of human authenticity in creative works. Some worry about AI's effect on social media interactions and genuine human connections.

The overall sentiment reveals a complex relationship with AI technology - while many embrace its practical benefits, there remains substantial ambivalence about its long-term implications for privacy, employment, and human creativity.

Summary B

Overall summary of the comments:

  • General sentiment: Many people report clear, practical benefits from AI, while a substantial minority are cautious or ambivalent, and a smaller group express strong skepticism or avoidance. Even among positive users, caution about accuracy, privacy, and dependence is common.

  • Most-cited benefits:

  • Efficiency and productivity: faster research, instant summaries, drafting and editing emails, letters, resumes, policies, and proposals; planning events and trips; organizing tasks; brainstorming ideas; automating repetitive work; code/data help; note taking.
  • Learning and support: tutoring-style explanations, simplifying complex topics, homework help, language learning, study aids, and confidence approaching problems.
  • Creativity: ideation, overcoming writer’s block, art and image editing/design, content prompts, shirt designs, and story generation.
  • Everyday life: recipe and meal planning (including dietary constraints), smart-home support, voice/dictation cleanup, skincare and fitness guidance, investing steps, sports analysis, and entertainment.

  • Emotional support: some found chatbots helpful for advice, perspective-taking in conflicts, and mental health encouragement.

  • Common usage patterns:

  • Many use AI daily or frequently as an “assistant” that saves time and improves output quality.
  • Others treat it as an optional tool for quick ideas or search augmentation.
  • A notable group say it hasn’t changed their life much yet, or they use it rarely.

  • Several users emphasize they fact-check AI, verify sources, and use it as a starting point rather than a final authority.

  • Accuracy and bias concerns:

  • Information can be inaccurate or irrelevant; users often validate claims and sources.
  • Perceived bias in what sources are surfaced.

  • Some tools help fix spelling/grammar and clarify text, but outputs still require human review.

  • Trust, authenticity, and societal effects:

  • Heightened distrust online due to deepfakes, AI-generated art/writing, and difficulty knowing what’s real.
  • Worries about diminished critical thinking and originality when over-relying on AI.
  • Educators note new challenges teaching authenticity and academic integrity.

  • A few users actively avoid AI content, calling it harmful or “theft.”

  • Privacy and security:

  • Strong, recurring anxiety about data collection, tracking, and lack of consent.

  • Wariness about how personal information might be used or exposed.

  • Jobs and economy:

  • Split views: AI as a threat to job security versus a tool that enhances employability or creates side-gig opportunities.

  • Some professionals fear eventual replacement; others report major productivity gains or new income streams.

  • Environmental and regulatory notes:

  • A small share mention environmental costs and call for stronger regulation, alongside continued innovation.

Bottom line: For many, AI functions as a powerful assistant that streamlines work, learning, and creativity, delivering meaningful time savings and better outcomes. At the same time, users widely recognize risks—especially privacy, accuracy, overdependence, and authenticity—and often respond by fact-checking, limiting use in certain contexts, or calling for guardrails to preserve trust and human originality.

answer.text_box: AI has not yet changed my life, as far as I know. It has caused some improvement in getting information quickly, but it is very often wrong. Hence, it is to a large extent, untrustworthy.
